TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SymmetricSecurityKey extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey
Public MustInherit Class SymmetricSecurityKey Inherits SecurityKey

Docs.summary: Represents the abstract base class for all keys that are generated using symmetric algorithms.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, this class is used by the infrastructure to transform XML using a symmetric key.

MemberSignature.Value: protected SymmetricSecurityKey ();
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Protected Sub New ()
protected: SymmetricSecurityKey();

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract byte[] GenerateDerivedKey (string algorithm, byte[] label, byte[] nonce, int derivedKeyLength, int offset);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GenerateDerivedKey(string algorithm, unsigned int8[] label, unsigned int8[] nonce, int32 derivedKeyLength, int32 offset) cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GenerateDerivedKey (algorithm As String, label As Byte(), nonce As Byte(), derivedKeyLength As Integer, offset As Integer) As Byte()
public: abstract cli::array <System::Byte> ^ GenerateDerivedKey(System::String ^ algorithm, cli::array <System::Byte> ^ label, cli::array <System::Byte> ^ nonce, int derivedKeyLength, int offset);
abstract member GenerateDerivedKey : string * byte[] * byte[] * int * int -> byte[]

Docs.param: A URI that represents the cryptographic algorithm to use to generate the derived key.
An array of that contains the label parameter for the cryptographic algorithm.
An array of that contains the nonce that is used to create a derived key.
The size of the derived key.
The position at which the derived key is located in the byte array that is returned from this method.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, generates a derived key using the specified cryptographic algorithm and parameters for the current key.
Docs.returns: An array of that contains the derived key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To specify P-SHA1 as the cryptographic algorithm, use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms.Psha1KeyDerivation> field.

abstract member GetDecryptionTransform : string * byte[] -> System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform

Docs.param: A cryptographic algorithm that decrypts cipher text, such as encrypted XML.
An array of that contains the initialization vector () for the specified algorithm.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a transform that decrypts cipher text using the specified cryptographic algorithm.
Docs.returns: An that represents the decryption transform.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the fields that represent decryption algorithms in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the algorithm.

Docs.param: A cryptographic algorithm that encrypts XML.
An array of that contains the initialization vector () for the specified algorithm.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a transform that encrypts XML using the specified cryptographic algorithm.
Docs.returns: An that represents the encryption transform.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the fields that represent decryption algorithms in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class to specify the algorithm.

Docs.param: The cryptographic algorithm to get the size of the initialization vector ().
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the size, in bits, of the initialization vector () that is required for the specified cryptographic algorithm.
Docs.returns: The size, in bits, of the initialization vector () that is required for the cryptographic algorithm specified in the parameter.
